question: What is a DDoS attack?
options: A denial of service attack that sends so much traffic to a network that it cannot respond fast enough; legitimate users become unable to use the service
An attempt to send SQL commands to the server in a way that will execute them against the database
An attempt to guess a user's password through brute force methods
An attempt to read the contents of a web page from another website, thereby stealing the user's private information
correctAnswer: A denial of service attack that sends so much traffic to a network that it cannot respond fast enough; legitimate users become unable to use the service

question: Application Gateway contains what additional optional security feature over a regular Load Balancer?
Formal support is not included in private preview mode.
There are no service level guarantees (SLA) when a service is in General Availability (GA).
How do you get access to services in Private Preview mode?
options: You must agree to a terms of use first
You must apply to use them
You cannot use private preview services
They are available in the marketplace
correctAnswer: You must apply to use them

question: What does it mean if a service is in General Availability (GA) mode?
options: The service has now reached public preview, and Microsoft will provide support for it
You have to apply to get selected in order to use that service
Anyone can use the service for any reason
Anyone can use the service but it must not be for production use
correctAnswer: Anyone can use the service for any reason

question: If your feature is in the General Availability phase, then your feature will receive support from all Microsoft support channels.
What does it mean if a service is in Private Preview mode?
options: You have to apply to get selected in order to use that service
Anyone can use the service but it must not be for production use
The service is generally available for use, and Microsoft will provide support for it
Anyone can use the service for any reason
correctAnswer: You have to apply to get selected in order to use that service

question: Why should you divide your application into multiple subnets as opposed to having all your web, application, and database servers running on the same subnet?
options: Each server type of your application requires its own subnet. It's not possible to mix web servers, database servers, and application servers on the same subnet
There are only a limited number of IP addresses available per subnet, so you need multiple subnets over a certain number

Separating your application into multiple subnets allows you to have different NSG security rules for each subnet, which can make it harder for a hacker to get from one compromised server onto another
correctAnswer: Separating your application into multiple subnets allows you to have different NSG security rules for each subnet, which can make it harder for a hacker to get from one compromised server onto another

question: Which feature within Azure collects all of the logs from various resources into a central dashboard, where you can run queries, view graphs, and create alerts on certain events?
Which tool within Azure is comprised of Azure Status, Service Health, and Resource Health?
Which feature within Azure alerts you to service issues that happen in Azure itself, not specifically related to your own resources?
If you wanted to get an alert every time a new virtual machine is created, where could you create that?
Azure Monitor allows you to monitor activity logs from Azure Active Directory.
What happens if Azure does not meet its own Service Level Agreement guarantee (SLA)?
options: You will be financially refunded a small amount of your monthly fee
It's not possible. Azure will always meet its SLA
The service will be free that month
correctAnswer: You will be financially refunded a small amount of your monthly fee

question: _______ allows you to use your own domain names for your internal, private Azure virtual machines.
Which tool within Azure helps you to track your compliance with various international standards and government laws?
Within the context of privacy and compliance, what does the acronym ISO stand for?
What is the default amount of credit that you are given when you first create an Azure Free account?
options: Azure does not give you any free credits when you create a free account
You can create 1 Linux VM, 1 Windows VM, and a number of other free services for the first year
You are given $50 per month for one year to put towards Azure services

question: Azure charges for bandwidth used inbound to Azure.
How do you stop your Azure account from incurring costs above a certain level without your knowledge?
options: Set up a billing alert to send you an email when it reaches a certain level
Only use Azure Functions which have a significant free limit
Switch to Azure Reserved Instances with Hybrid Benefit for VMs
Implement the Azure spending limit in the Account Centre
correctAnswer: Implement the Azure spending limit in the Account Centre

question: How many hours are available free when using the Azure B1S General Purpose Virtual Machines under an Azure Free account in the first 12 months?
Which Azure website tool is available for you to estimate the future costs of your Azure products and services by adding products to a shopping basket and helping you calculate the costs?
In Azure, resource tags are _______ that can be associated with each resource.
What effect does setting a budget have on a subscription?
options: All charges will stop until a higher budget is approved
It can alert you when the budget is reached or start an automation
All resources will be stopped when the budget is hit
The only effect would be the budget being added as a column in reports
correctAnswer: It can alert you when the budget is reached or start an automation

question: What type of documents does the Microsoft Service Trust Portal provide?
options: A list of standards that Microsoft follows, penetration test results, security assessments, white papers, FAQs, and other documents that can be used to show Microsoft's compliance efforts
Documentation on the individual Azure services and solutions
A tool that helps you manage your compliance to various standards
Specific recommendations about your usage of Azure and ways you can improve
correctAnswer: A list of standards that Microsoft follows, penetration test results, security assessments, white papers, FAQs, and other documents that can be used to show Microsoft's compliance efforts

question: Where can you go to see what standards Microsoft is in compliance with?
How does the use of availability zones improve the availability of your application?
options: Keeps your servers in separate regions, in a globally-redundant architecture
Keeps your servers in separate data centres in the same region, protecting them from data centre-specific issues such as power outages or internet disconnection
If something was to happen to your application, a new copy of it would be deployed to another data centre almost instantly so that your customers would hardly notice any downtime
Keeps your servers closer together for faster inter-server communication and lower overall latency
correctAnswer: Keeps your servers in separate data centres in the same region, protecting them from data centre-specific issues such as power outages or internet disconnection

question: A virtual network must be in the same region as the resources attached to it.
Which Azure networking solution supports the highest-speed connection between your corporate office and an Azure region near you?
Which of the following characteristics is essential for for a system to be considered highly available in a cloud computing environment?
options: It's impossible to create a highly available system
The system must be designed for resilience, with no single points of failure
The system must operate on a minimum of two virtual machines
The system must maintain 100% availability at all times
correctAnswer: The system must be designed for resilience, with no single points of failure

question: In the context of cloud computing, how is the benefit of agility best described?
options: The ability to swiftly recover from a large-scale regional failure
The system's ability to easily scale up when it reaches full capacity
The ability to rapidly provision new resources
The ability to quickly respond to and drive changes in the market
correctAnswer: The ability to quickly respond to and drive changes in the market

question: Which of the following characteristics of a cloud-based system primarily contribute to its elasticity?
options: The system's ability to dynamically increase and decrease capacity based on real-time demand
The system's ability to recover automatically after a crash
The system's ability to withstand denial-of-service attacks
The system's ability to maintain availability while updates are being implemented
correctAnswer: The system's ability to dynamically increase and decrease capacity based on real-time demand

question: What is a primary benefit of opting for a consumption-based pricing model over a time-based pricing model in cloud services?
options: The ability to easily predict the future cost of the service
A simpler and easier-to-understand pricing model
Significant cost savings when the resources aren't needed for constant use
It always being cheaper to pay for consumption rather than paying hourly
correctAnswer: Significant cost savings when the resources aren't needed for constant use

question: Which of the following is considered a downside to using Capital Expenditure (CapEx)?
options: It does not require a lot of upfront money
You are not guaranteed to make a profit
You must wait over a period of years to depreciate that investment on your taxes
You can deduct expenses as they occur
correctAnswer: You must wait over a period of years to depreciate that investment on your taxes

question: What is considered a benefit of consumption-based pricing?
options: Amount can be deprecated as a capital expense over many years
Ability to save money by scaling-down services when not required
correctAnswer: Ability to save money by scaling-down services when not required

question: You can create your own policies if built-in Azure Policy is not sufficient to your needs.
Which of these describes Azure Virtual Desktop?
options: A customisable dashboard which tracks the health of your Azure services in the regions where you use them
A Windows 10 or Windows 11 desktop instance in the cloud, which allows a user to log in from almost any device and access their work computer
A comprehensive solution for collecting, analysing, and acting on telemetry from your cloud and on-premises environments
A service that scans your Azure configuration and recommends changes to optimise deployments, increase security, and save you money
correctAnswer: A Windows 10 or Windows 11 desktop instance in the cloud, which allows a user to log in from almost any device and access their work computer

question: When deploying a virtual machine into an availability set, how does Azure treat that VM differently?
options: It will autoscale the VM, adding and removing instances as demand increases and decreases
It will place the VM on a physically separate server and roll out Azure updates to it in a staggered manner
It will place the VM in a different data centre from other VMs in the set
It will place the VM on the same physical server as the other VMs in the set
correctAnswer: It will place the VM on a physically separate server and roll out Azure updates to it in a staggered manner

question: You can run a containerised application on a virtual machine.
explanation: Since you have full control over a virtual machine, you can run a containerised app on it, including installing Docker Desktop on that machine.

question: _______ are isolated (single-tenant) environments where you can deploy one or more Azure App Services on your own virtual network.
You can create a virtual machine without attaching it to a virtual network.
What is the data privacy and information protection regulation that took effect across Europe in May 2018?
What does the letter R in RBAC stand for?
What is a policy initiative in Azure?
options: Requiring all resources in Azure to use tags
Assigning permissions to a role in Azure
The ability to group policies together
correctAnswer: The ability to group policies together

question: Your organisation has implemented an Azure Policy that restricts the type of virtual machine instances that you can use. How can you create a VM that is blocked by the policy?
options: The only way is to remove the policy, create the resource and add the policy back
Subscription Owners (Administrators) can create resources regardless of what the policy restricts
Use an account that has Contributor or above permissions to the resource group
correctAnswer: The only way is to remove the policy, create the resource and add the policy back

question: Which of the following methods of deploying a virtual machine provides the highest availability SLA?
options: Two or more virtual machines across availability zones in the same region
Two or more virtual machines in a data centre
Two or more virtual machines in an availability set
correctAnswer: Two or more virtual machines across availability zones in the same region

question: In the context of Azure's high availability solutions, what is the primary purpose of Azure Availability Zones?
options: They allow manual selection of data centres for virtual machine placement to achieve superior availability compared to other options
They represent certain server racks within individual data centres, specifically designed by Azure for higher uptime
They serve as a folder structure in Azure used for organising resources such as databases, virtual machines, and virtual networks
They are synonymous with an Azure region
correctAnswer: They allow manual selection of data centres for virtual machine placement to achieve superior availability compared to other options

question: How many regions does Azure have in Brazil?
Approximately how many regions does Azure have around the world?
